dt: {bc}severe depression characterized especially by profound sadness and despair

dt.t: Tense, irritable, I crashed into a fit of {wi}melancholia{/wi} and found myself crying over inconsequential problems.
A depressed Johnson was not the father figure that Boswell, himself prey to crippling bouts of {wi}melancholia{/wi} and insecurity, wanted to celebrate.
There's a touching {wi}melancholia{/wi} to his voice …
Like Wallace's breakthrough novel, "Infinite Jest," "The Pale King" is pervaded by an air of {wi}melancholia{/wi}, an acute sense of loss.
